name: typed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
type
type verb [I or T]
(WRITE)
B1 to write using a machine, either a computer keyboard or a typewriter: She asked me to type a couple of letters. He can type very quickly. I was typing away into the early hours of the morning just to get it done.
More examplesFewer examplesHer typewriter clacked noisily as she typed out the letter.Oops! I've typed two L's by mistake.It would look more professional if the letter was typed.By typing in simple commands you could pick up objects and talk to other avatars, with your words displayed in a cartoon bubble above your head.He had injured his left hand and was typing one-handed.
